name: Uva Ursi- Arctostaphylos uva-ursis

uses: Infusion can be diluted and used as a sitz bath

primaryUses.antibacterialActions: against Staphylococcus, Pseudomonas, Proteus, and E. Coli bacterias

potentialAdverseEffects: can potentially act as an emmenagogue and/or disrupt blood flow to fetus
hydroquinone (as an isolated substance) was used in skin whitening creams and was banned by the FDA after being shown to be carcinogenic in rat studies
one case of carcinogenicity has been reported in a 56-year-old woman who took Uva ursi as a simple for 3 years straight
whole plant extracts have been found to be generally safe in moderate doses for up to 4 weeks
avoid larger doses of fresh leaves
